title: SES to work with NorthStar on space situational awareness
summary: Satellite operator SES announced March 31 it is working with Canadian startup NorthStar Earth & Space on developing space situational awareness (SSA) data products to support its fleet of communications satellites.

title: SpaceX rolls upgraded Super Heavy booster to the launch pad
summary: SpaceX has begun transporting an upgraded Super Heavy booster to its South Texas launch facilities, where the rocket will likely be tested...

title: Northrop Grumman weighing options for new Artemis lunar lander competition
summary: Northrop Grumman says it’s still considering whether to rejoin a Blue Origin-led team for a second Artemis lunar lander competition or to go on its own.

title: Jeff Matthews joins Radian Aerospace as director of strategy
summary: Radian Aerospace, a startup developing a reusable spaceplane, announced March 30 that Jeff Matthews, a founding member of Deloitte Consulting’s space sector practice, would become the company’s director of strategy.

title: A NASA astronaut just landed in a Russian spacecraft, and all is well
summary: What happens next will probably depend on the war in Ukraine.

title: Soyuz returns astronaut and cosmonauts from space station
summary: A Soyuz spacecraft carrying an American astronaut and two Russian cosmonauts landed in Kazakhstan March 30, an ordinary end of a mission in extraordinary times.

title: Virgin Orbit looks beyond satellite launch for growth opportunities
summary: Small launch vehicle company Virgin Orbit says it sees opportunities not just in satellite launch but also in hypersonics as it looks to increase its revenue.

title: China to launch Einstein Probe in 2023 to observe violent cosmic events
summary: A Chinese wide-field x-ray space observatory has passed a major review and is expected to launch next year to detect flashes from cataclysmic cosmic events.

title: SpaceX to end Crew Dragon capsule production as Starship’s shadow grows
summary: Reuters reports that SpaceX has begun to shut down Crew Dragon capsule production after assembling a fleet of four reusable spacecraft, highlighting...

title: NASA astronaut back on Earth after record-setting flight
summary: NASA astronaut Mark Vande Hei joined two Russian cosmonauts aboard a Soyuz spacecraft, undocked from the International Space Station and plunged back to Earth Wednesday, landing on the steppe of Kazakhstan to close out a U.S.-record 355-day stay in space.
